text: Keys to the City is the debut studio album by American jazz pianist Mulgrew Miller, released on June 28, 1985 by Landmark Records. ==Background== The album is dedicated to Miller's wife, Tanya, and musicians who inspired him. The record contains eight compositions: four originals and four jazz standards. The originals are: the blues-inspired "Song for Darnell", named after his son; "Promethean", inspired by a Greek myth; "Portrait of a Mountain"; and "Saud's Run". The last two are dedicated to McCoy Tyner. ==Track listing== ==Personnel== *Ira Coleman – bass *Marvin Smith – drums *Mulgrew Miller – piano ==References== Category:1985 albums Category:Landmark Records albums Category:Albums produced by Orrin Keepnews Category:Mulgrew Miller albums
title: Keys to the City (Mulgrew Miller album)
